title: Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome: where is the pathway?
patient: A 31-year old male presented to the emergency room with palpitations. The electrocardiogram (ECG) showed atrial fibrillation with preexcitation (). After electrical cardioversion, there was evidence of preexcitation in sinus rhythm (). Invasive electrophysiology study was performed, which confirmed the presence of a single accessory pathway. What is the most likely site of the pathway, and from where should you start to map?
